dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.service.spec.ServiceSpecCharacteristic
dataStructure.description:
This is an abstract base class that represents the key features of this ServiceSpecification. For example, bandwidth is characteristic of many different types of services; if bandwidth is important (e.g., from the point-of-view of a Customer obtaining this Service via a Product) then bandwidth would be a ServiceCharacteristic for that particular Service. Note that in this example, bandwidth would have to be defined as an invariant feature that multiple Services use. Otherwise, it should be defined as a ServiceCharacteristic.

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: ServiceSpecCharacteristic

child.name: iD
child.description:
A unique identifier for the CharacteristicSpecification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: iD

child.name: name
child.description:
A word, term, or phrase by which the CharacteristicSpecification is known and distinguished from other CharacteristicSpecifications.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: name

child.name: description
child.description:
A narrative that explains the CharacteristicSpecification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: description

child.name: _valueType
child.description:
A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text, and so forth.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: _valueType

child.name: minCardinality
child.description:
The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: minCardinality

child.name: maxCardinality
child.description:
The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: maxCardinality

child.name: extensible
child.description:
An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for an Entity.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: extensible

child.name: validFor
child.description:
The period of time for which a characteristic is applicable.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: validFor

child.name: unique
child.description:
An indicator that specifies if a value is unique for the specification. Possible values are; "unique while value is in effect" and "unique whether value is in effect or not"

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: unique

child.name: derivationFormula
child.description:
A rule or principle represented in symbols, numbers, or letters, often in the form of an equation used to derive the value of a characteristic value.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: derivationFormula
